result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert A. Forster Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilbert A. Forster Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gilbert A. Forster in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:15 a.m. Agreement stated - State has complied with VWNR. Restitution has been collected. State moves to amend to 943.20 (1)(a) with penalty under (3) (a), Def will plead to amended charge, joint recommendation for $100 plus costs. Atty Cveykus and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Court grants amendment to misd theft. No contest plea. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties reviewed. Atty Cveykus satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis stipulated. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of misd. theft. Atty Cveykus asks Court to adopt agreement. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will approve agreement. Orders $100 plus costs. Restitution has already been paid in full. No DNA surcharge. Pmt plan. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Gilbert A. Forster in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Time limit waived for preliminary hearing   Bond continued  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No contact with J. or G. R.

Defendant Gilbert A. Forster in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads charge, party to a crime, with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.  State request signature bond.  Bond set by Court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
